channel.title: A "noob" to minecraft
channel.description:
Okay, i've been hosting my RSPS for about 5 months and got very bored. So, after playing some minecraft online. I've now opened my new server, however i'm still pretty confused how people have got different ranks and /warp commands!
Even the simple command /spawn is not there.
I know this is a very nooby question. But, we all start somewhere aye!

item.title: A "noob" to minecraft
item.dc:creator: @NumberEleven NumberEleven
item.description:
@NumberEleven wrote:

Sorry, after re reading this post, i realised how basic this question is.

I dont think the reactions was so necessary. I only asked for help.

Read full topic

item.title: A "noob" to minecraft
item.dc:creator: @carecarecare carecarecare
item.description:
@carecarecare wrote:

1: You download bukkit.
2: You run the .jar
3: You add plugins to the plugins folder.
4: You use the plugins

Read full topic

item.title: A "noob" to minecraft
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Edges_surf:

most people that started making rsps like me, then go to make a minecraft server find it really difficult to start off, e.g, me! ive been trying to make a minecraft server for months lol but its alot different to rsps and u say ur not a spoon feeding community, how the fuck do u learn if no one teaches you!

What is difficult about it? You don’t program it or anything, all your do is put it online. There is no such thing as leeching or anything. How have you been failing for “months”.

Read full topic

item.title: A "noob" to minecraft
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

People get all these additional things by installing plugins. For example, you can install Bukkit (Guide here: http://forums.bukkit.org/threads/how-to-install-bukkit-newb-friendly.245/ ). Once you’ve installed Bukkit you can choose from their library of plugins:

http://plugins.bukkit.org/#ti=&ta=all&au=&subm=false&pno=0

The installation instructions vary based on the plugin, but it’s common sense anyway and most contain instructions! Just put most of them in the plugins directory once you’ve installed Bukkit. For the more complex ones you have MYSQL and so on.

Just use the search bar on the plugins, there is loads.

Read full topic

item.title: A "noob" to minecraft
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“NumberEleven, post:8, topic:410266”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=511550.msg3712185#msg3712185 date=1313426453]

Add my skype/msn

Skype: Elliot_Field
Hotmail: Elliot291@hotmail.com

Please help me out.

Look in the tutorials section, we are not a spoin feeding community.
[/quote]

Everyone starts somewhere bro.[/quote]
Starting a minecraft server is easier then starting a RSPS. Simply change like 3 lines in “server.properties” then load the server. Boom, you have a minecraft server. Also the topic in the tutorials section describes more than needed for you to have posted this.

Read full topic

item.title: A "noob" to minecraft
item.dc:creator: @kitsios kitsios
item.description:
@kitsios wrote:

You need to get a bukkit server and some plugins, like Essentials that manage teleporting and spawning. See http://forum.bukkit.org

Read full topic
